mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Betsey Mason to S.W. Tiffey, 1870 February 23
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mason, Betsey (Elizabeth Price), 1802-1873
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Betsey Mason, Vice Regent for Virginia, to S.W. Tiffey, secretary, February 23, 1870. Copy. Colross. Urges Mrs. Tiffey not to expose herself to needless fatigue in trips to Alexandria. Mrs. Mason wishes she had the home conveniences to have cared for the Regent properly that winter. Mr. Strider called and told of Mr. Lewis's Washington relics which Mrs. Mason thinks the Regent might obtain, but does not want her to deal with an agent. Mentions prominent women who might be interested in Mount Vernon. Comments on Mr. Lossing's satisfaction with Mount Vernon and profits he has made on his book, contracting the latter with the Regent's service without monetary recompense.
